post.title: Digitising Germana Demokratia Respubliko bildoj kaj faktoj - should be done soon
Some of my views on the Blockchain being adopted by banks, briefly
New Soviet Man - excerpt from 'Vladimir Ilyich Lenin' by the Soviet poet Vladimir Mayakovsky
post.body:
Who needs a "1"?
The voice of a "1"
    is thinner than a squeak.

Who will hear it?
    Only the wife...

A "1" is nonsense.
    A "1" is zero.

-[Vladimir Mayakovsky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vladimir_Mayakovsky)

post.title: Red Star by Alexander Bogdanov
post.body:
![Red Star](https://i.imgur.com/a7U1cLL.jpg)

I came across a book recently which I'm about half way through, it's called [Red Star](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Star_%28novel%29) and written by Bolshevik [Alexander Bogdanov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Bogdanov). I certainly recommend this book to everyone that can be bothered to read.

Unfortunately (?) the book was written over one hundred years ago and the science is well behind, but it does delve into communist ideals which I wasn't formerly aware. For instance, did you know that communists - of that period at least - preferred clothes for their functionality over their fashion properties? 

Go grab the book from [here](http://www.monoskop.org/images/4/48/Bogdanov_Alexander_Red_Star_The_First_Bolshevik_Utopia.pdf).

post.title: Vi devus lerni Esperanto // You should learn Esperanto
post.body: Like the rest of you, I studied foreign languages at school... and like the rest of you, I left without knowing a word. Last year I picked up Esperanto, now I know ~1000+ root words which can be combined with suffixes and prefixes to make thousands more words. I highly recommend having a look at the Duolingo course for this awesome language: https://www.duolingo.com/course/eo/en/Learn-Esperanto-Online
